Dear Ms. Madaj:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on February
18-26, 2020. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract
and Modified Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a
written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing
rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's performance
within a probationary period or not later than 6 months
after the staff member assumes his or her current
responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a written
evaluation shall be conducted each year.
One of seven employee files reviewed did not contain a completed annual
evaluation. Additionally, technical assistance was provided regarding two
evaluations reviewed that were signed by the employee and supervisor several
months after the date of the evaluation. Evaluations should be signed and dated
upon completion to accurately verify the completion date.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months
before placement or a new physical examination shall be
completed within 30 calendar days after placement.
(iii) A physical examination every 14 months.
One of six open foster care case files reviewed was missing an updated physical
examination.
R 400.12417 Foster parent information.
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement
of a child:
4

One of six open foster care case files reviewed did not contain documentation that
all of the required information was provided to the foster parents upon placement.
This information must be documented on the Placement Outline (DHS-3307.)
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of six open foster care case files reviewed contained one service plan that was
completed one day late.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED – LSR dated 3/27/2018, CAP approved
3/13/2018 & LSR dated 2/11/2019, CAP approved 3/1/19.
R 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time.
An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation and
parenting time that contains, at a minimum, all of the
following:
(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster
child and the foster parent in the foster parent's home at
least once every month.
One of six open foster care case files reviewed was missing documentation of one
monthly visit.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED –LSR dated 2/11/2019, CAP approved
3/1/19 at which time FOM 722-06H was cited.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation
(n) Change of placement documentation as required by R
400.12405.
One of one independent living case file reviewed was missing documentation related
to the youth’s move to independent living placement.
R 400.12511 Independent living contract.
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living services
for a youth, the agency shall document all of the following
5

information in the case record within 30 calendar days of
termination of its services:
(a) The reason for the termination.
One of two closed independent living files reviewed did not contain the required
closing documentation.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
When an agency borrows a home from another agency or a
tribe, it is required that all of the permissions and
information identified in subrule (1) be received prior to the
child being placed.
(c) A copy of the initial evaluation with written
endorsement by the borrowing agency that the evaluation
is acceptable.
(d) A copy of the current reevaluation with written
endorsement by the borrowing agency that the evaluation
is acceptable.
Two of three borrowed home files reviewed contained evaluations that were
endorsed one day after the child’s placement in the home.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there

had reports that identified the family’s involvement with Child Protective Services.
FOM 722-09C FOSTER CARE ACTION SUMMARY REQUIREMENTS
All foster care cases where there is:
1. A replacement.
2. Termination from foster care placement.
One of six open foster care cases reviewed was missing one action summary
related to a placement change.
FOM 801 Medical Passports
Medical Passport Receipt Documentation
Receipt of the medical passport by the required parties is
documented in MiSACWIS by uploading the signed and
dated signature page into the Health Profile section.
MiSACWIS Medical Passport Receipt Requirement
Five of six open foster care case files reviewed did not contain medical passports
completed as required. Five files were missing medical provider signatures and one
file was missing one quarterly update.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED –LSR dated 2/11/2019, CAP approved
3/1/19.
FOM 722-08C Required Participation in Development - Parents and Youth
over 14-Years Old
All treatment plans with a report date of August 1, 2017, or
later must have signatures from all appropriate case
members within 30 days of the report date.
One of six open foster care case files reviewed contained one treatment plan with
signatures dated outside of the 30-day requirement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED –LSR dated 2/11/2019, CAP approved
3/1/19 at which time MISEP 6.33(c) was cited.
FOM 722-09 Supervisory Approval – USP
Case service plan approval process requires the foster care
supervisor to:
• Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of
the report date.
7

One of six open foster care case files reviewed contained one report that was
approved outside of the 14-day requirement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED –LSR dated 2/11/2019, CAP approved
3/1/19 at which time FOM 722-08 was cited.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
MISEP 6.54 - Page 35 Psychotropic Medication, Informed Consent
(Commitment 90). Technical assistance was provided regarding documenting
within the case file that the required signatures were obtained and the documents
were forwarded for uploading.
R 400.12327(7) Technical assistance was provided regarding a foster home
corrective action plan that minimally addressed the issues that caused the citation.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request or require consultation.
8

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were two substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
There was one incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The special evaluation reports and corrective action plans related to these
incidents were reviewed and barring the technical assistance documented
within this report, no other concerns were noted.
The agency has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The DCWL Field Analyst attended the exit conference with the agency
administrators by phone and indicated that there were no safety or services
concerns reported by the caregivers interviewed.
The staff and administrators interviewed indicated that they had no concerns to
report and described positive experiences working for the agency.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
